statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

header.gameNote: BIG SKY TOURNAMENT AT OGDEN UT

article.headline: Northern Arizona 78, Montana 71
article.story: OGDEN, Utah (AP) -- Tyrone Bazy scored 20 points as Northern Arizona defeated Montana 78-71 in the Big Sky semifinals on Tuesday. The Lumberjacks advanced to the conference championship game for the second straight year. Northern Arizona will play Weber State in the championship game on Wednesday. The winner of Wednesday nights title game will receive the Big Skys automatic bid to the NCAA tournament. The Lumberjacks, who lost to Montana in the Big Sky championship game last year, started quickly then went ice cold against the Grizzlies. It took Northern Arizona just 12 minutes to build a 33-13 lead. The Lumberjacks shot 64 percent from the field during that span and looked like they were going to cruise to the conference title game. Northern Arizona, however, made just two of its next 15 attempts and watched its lead slip. It took the Lumberjacks nearly seven minutes to make a basket in the second half. A three-pointer by Mike Chavez gave the Grizzlies their biggest lead of the game at 49-45. The Lumberjacks regained their shooting touch down the stretch, with Bazy and Kyle Landry leading the team's final surge. Landry, who scored 18 points, made two foul shots to give Northern Arizona the lead for good at 60-58. Bazy made a layup to put the Lumberjacks ahead by four points and Montana didnt get closer the rest of the way. Ruben Boykin Jr. had 14 points and 10 rebounds for Northern Arizona. Andrew Strait led Montana with 22 points on 11-for-14 shooting from the field
